constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 133 (Thursday, July 29, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. WATERS:
H.R. 4791.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, cl. 1, To pay debts and provide for
the common Defense and General Welfare of the United States.
Article I, Section 8 cl. 3, To regulate Commerce with
Foreign Nations, Among the Several States, and with the
Indian Tribes.
Article I, Section 8, cl. 18, To make all laws which shall
be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution the
powers enumerated under section 8 and all other Powers vested
by the Constitution in the Government of the United States,
or in any Department or Officer thereof.
[Page H4293]

latestAction.text: Mr. Hoyer asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Energy and Commerce be discharged from further consideration of H.R. 4791 and offered an amendment to the bill. Objection heard. (text: CR H4302)

title: Protecting Renters from Evictions Act of 2021
